div1.p: His Majesty, King Leopold, Belgium His Majesty:-
The High Standing Committee of the Massachussetts Catholic Order of Foresters, representing 100,000 souls, in meeting assembled January 14th, 1907, endorsed the following resolution:-
WHEREAS it has come to our knowledge that accusations have been made against King Leopold's administration of the Congo Free State.
WHEREAS we believe that these accusations are unfounded and are inspired by religious jealousy and by the desire of a certain strong nation to extend its power in Africa.
Be it resolved, and it is hereby resolved:

That we deprecate the use of means such as have marked the action of our protestant bretheren in this matter; the defaming of an individual is a serious breach of Christ's Commands; the defaming of a whole nation and of a Christian King is most serious.

Resolved, second, that relying on the testimony of trustworthy Catholic Bishops and missionaries in the Congo, of travellers who have visited the country and who know the actual conditions prevailing there, and of the impartial commissioners who recently reported on the subject, we see no greater reason
for an international investigation of King Leopold's rule in the Congo than for an international investigation of the administration of any other Power in Africa.
Resolved, third, that no body of men will go farther to redress the human misery than members of this organization.
Resolved, fourth, that we extend to the caluminated King our sympathy with him in this matter in which he has been so unjustly occused.

Resolved, fifth, that copies of these resolutions be sent to the President of the United States, the Secretary of State, the Senate Committee on Foreign Relations, the two Senators from Massachussetts, and to His Majesty, King Leopold.
Attest-- (signed) JOHN J. LEONARD High Secretary-Treasurer.
